title: 1BR Apartment Available 2/1 Near Clark Park
description:
Cute 1bed/1bath in Spruce-Osage neighborhood in West Philly available 2/1. The apartment is the entire third floor of a victorian twin. The rent includes gas, water and wifi (if you choose to share internet with the downstairs neighbors who are the landlords). The current lease ends 8/14/23. You can either choose to sublet until the end of the lease or start a new one year lease starting 2/1. Apartment comes unfurnished. I am the current tenant, but the landlords have requested that you share what you do, where you work, and if you are tidy, so please include a blurb about yourself in your message to me.
Features:
- Small pets negotiable (pet deposit required)
- Laundry on site (free!)
- Porch
- Great location 44th/Larchwood
- Basement storage
- Bathtub
- Super close to Knockbox, Green Line Cafe, Alif Brew, Clark Park
- Street parking (permit required on Larchwood)
- Landlords are a sweet family that live downstairs. Super responsive and helpful!
- AC units available
Move in requirements:
- Pet deposit (if applicable) + $1300 security deposit
- On 2/1 you'd pay $1350 for the first month (rent + utilities)

title: CENTER CITY PHILADELPHIA APT NEAR RITTENHOUSE SQ BE A PART OF HISTORY
description:
Offering Studio, 1 & 2 bedroom apartments. Center City Philadelphia Apartments Near Rittenhouse Square Be a part of history! ICON mixes the beauty of the past with the modern amenities of today. Included on theÃ‚Â National Register of Historic Places this incredible rental building soars to new heights, just like its iconic, ziggurat-topped peak. Looking for a downtown Philadelphia apartment nearÃ‚Â Rittenhouse Square? You've found it! ICON is the most exciting rental property to ever grace Rittenhouse Square. A quintessential example of the Art Deco exuberance that defined the 1920s and 30s, ICON's design is inspired by Art Deco's geometric shapes and today's streamlined lifestyle. With this historic luxury building, you can be within steps of all the fine dining, high-end retail and cultural offerings that Philadelphia has to offer. The most fashionable edifice of its day, ICON is as rich in history as it is in beauty. Opened in 1930, at the beginning of the Great Depression, the building's ground floor tenants included both Cunard's White Star Line and the United States Lines, and the esteemed Pew family maintained a pied-a-terre on the 25th Floor. Today, this history echoes throughout ICON, a building that is a rare architectural experience. The lobby is so stunning it will make you stop in your tracks, with its Art Deco-styled elevators, glazed black brick and grey porcelain flooring and a cast-bronze portal. And the residences feature the kind of classic fixtures, state-of-the-art appliances and iconic details that can only be found in a landmark building. Apartment amenities: Kitchen features include sleek high gloss white cabinets with soft close drawers and doors.Ã‚Â Stainless steel appliances, including a glass top electric range and microwave. Glass-tile, kitchen backsplash. Quartz top kitchen island. Engineered hardwood flooring. Baths with sleek, high gloss cabinets and quartz countertops, glazed 12x12 porcelain tile. Air conditioning. Carpeting in bedrooms. Washer and dryer. Amazing views of Philadelphia. Enhanced Penthouse level finish on 23/24 floors. Venetian medicine cabinet. Wheelchair Accessible Apartments Available. 2 inch wood window blinds. Community amenities: Sky Deck with 360 View, Includes Grilling Station and Outdoor Living Area with Fireplace. Wellness Floor Featuring a Yoga Studio, Cardio, Weights, TRX & BoxingÃ‚Â . Private Dining Room with Fireplace and Serving Kitchen. Club Level with Kitchen, Billiards, Flat-Screen TVs and Large Screen. Media Room for Private Parties. Business Center with Computers, Printers, Conference Rooms with A/V Capabilities. Media RoomÃ‚Â . Full Service Concierge. Parking Garage w/ Valet Parking Option. Package Receiving. Pet Grooming Station. On Site Property Management. Elevator. Charging Stations for Electric Cars. Cold Storage for Grocery Delivery. 24 Hour Emergency Maintenance. Pets Welcome: $500 one-time fee. Max 2 pets per home. $35 / month pet rent. On-Site Green Drop Donation Box. ** Pricing and availability subject to change on a daily basis ** Photos are of model units ** Parking may be available for additional fee **

description:
SouthStar Lofts offers luxury loft living along the famed Avenue of the Arts in Philadelphia PA. Each home features spacious floor plans with bamboo wood flooring, modern kitchens with stainless steel appliances, upgraded cabinetry, granite countertops and floor to ceiling windows boasting impressive city views. Homes also include a washer and dryer, spacious walk-in closets and a private balcony in select homes. Our pet-friendly community is smoke-free and includes access to our state-of-the-art fitness center and clubroom with demonstration kitchen. Feel secure with controlled access entry, on-site management and maintenance teams. Walkable distance to restaurants, parks, theaters and shopping - including our own on-site retail with City Diner and Kosmo's Pizzeria. Also, commuting has never been easier with on-site parking and bike storage available, easy access to major highways with the Broad Street Subway Station and multiple forms of public transportation right outside your door. title: Welcome home to Pier 3 Condominiums at Penn's Landing!
description:
Welcome home to Pier 3 Condominiums at Penn's Landing! This 2br/2ba 1300SF suns soaked unit on the Delaware River has amazing waterfront views and 1 car garage parking. The spacious open concept living room offers a wood-burning fireplace and direct access to the newly renovated kitchen. The owners suite has ample closet space, an en-suite bathroom, hardwood floors, and a private balcony facing the newly renovated atrium. You will love the second bedroom that has a spiral staircase to the bonus loft area which has significant amounts of extra living/bookshelf/storage space. In-unit washer/dryer. Pier 3 Condominiums at Penn's Landing provides the following on-site amenities: 24-hour concierge, heated indoor pool, fitness room, sun deck on the Delaware River, and relaxation lounge. This pet friendly building allows 2 animals up to 40 pounds each. Short walking distance to Spruce Street Harbor Park, Blue Cross RiverRink, Cherry Street Pier and Race Street Pier. Close to historical attractions including the Liberty Bell and Independence Hall, Independence Visitor Center, National Constitution Center, and Museum of the American Revolution. Unit comes fully furnished or unfurnished based on your preference.
3 N Columbus Blvd #TD442

Nestled on a leafy side street in the heart of Northern Liberties, your new home awaits at 924 N Randolph Street. This 3-story brick front home offers the perfect city refuge, within easy walking distance to a fantastic array of restaurants, shops and entertainment. Enter the open concept living area greeted by a lovely wood-burning fireplace with original stone mantelpiece, warm hardwood floors, high ceilings and charming original woodwork details. The classic black and white kitchen houses a full suite of appliances-including a dishwasher and brand-new refrigerator. The skylight affords wonderful natural light. Out back just beyond the kitchen is the spacious and private rear patio with space for relaxing & entertaining, and gardening in the built-in planter bed. Downstairs the unfinished basement has lots of dry storage and updated mechanicals. Up on the 2nd floor you’ll find a full laundry room—no more hauling heavy baskets to the basement! Plus, the large bathroom and a sunny east facing bedroom. The 3rd floor offers 2 more bedrooms with a lovely natural light throughout. Outside, just about everything you need can be found within walking distance including a grocery store, pet store, hardware store, bowling alley, gyms, salons, and public transportation. Favorite restaurants such as Cantina dos Segundos, Bardot Café, Honey’s, Ortleibs, North Third and Federal Donuts make it easy to see why this is one of the most popular neighborhoods in Philadelphia.
924 N Randolph St

title: Beautiful, bright and open condo available for rent
description:
Beautiful, bright and open condo available for rent in the Tivoli building in the Art Museum Area. This condo is located on the second floor of the garden units, with no more units above. It offers 2 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, washer/dryer, GARAGE PARKING (negotiable) and is overlooking the central courtyard with pergolas and fountain. You can access to unit either via the main building/concierge or via the private courtyard gate. Walk into the open concept living/dinning/kitchen area that has plenty of space and a pantry. Both bedrooms are large with spacious closets and are overlooking Center City Skyline (South) receiving a great amount of day light. The unit offers soaring ceiling height and hardwood floors throughout. The building has 24 hour concierge, fitness center, playroom for kids and a conference room with a kitchen. Located in an unbeatable location within walking distance to Whole Foods, Target, Clemente Playground, Philadelphia Sports Club, the Barnes, Philadelphia Art Museums, The Franklin Institute, City Hall, Septa, the prestigious Julia R. Masterman School and so much more!
1900 Hamilton St #D16

title: Luxurious one bedroom plus den in The Wilson, a boutique apartment
description:
Luxurious one bedroom plus den in The Wilson, a boutique apartment building on the corner of 16th and Sansom Streets in the heart of Center City. The home features an open kitchen with island, custom countertops and backsplash, stainless steel appliances and modern cabinetry. The bathroom is appointed in designer finishes and has a modern vanity and large walk-in shower. Additional highlights include a flat-panel wall-mounted TV, washer/dryer, excellent closet space, oversized windows and wood-style plank tile floors. The Wilson has a secure entry system controllable by a panel in each unit and by each resident's smart phone. The building is wired for Comcast and residents pay electric, cable and Internet. Residents enjoy a central location less than 3 blocks from Rittenhouse Square, 2 blocks to the Market Street west office corridor, 2 blocks to The Avenue of the Arts, 1 block to Rittenhouse Row shopping and dining, and a plethora of restaurants and shops within close walking distance.
1602 Sansom St #1

description: Meticulously renovated down to the studs, this thoughtfully designed one bedroom, one bathroom home has incorporated eco-friendly building elements with high-end modern design.
